abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the MaIé  Airport Upgrading Project. This
            plan provided for the extension of the runway and expansion
            of the terminal building and aircraft parking areas in
            phased stages. The principle objective of the project was to
            improve facilities at the Malé airport to meet the growth in
            tourist traffic and strengthen Maldives Airport
            Authority's (MAA) operating capabilities. Bank's
            performance was highly satisfactory. Borrower's
            performance was highly satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            were as follows: a) the formation of a team specifically
            assigned to manage project implementation is essential
            towards ensuring effective and timely implementation; b)
            delay in securing financing can jeopardise effective
            implementation and can be costly in terms of demobilisation
            and remobilisation costs incurred by contractors; c)
            passenger or aircraft movements forecast for Malé Airport
            has always been under-estimated; and d) consultants who are
            in par with the Client's interests is essential to
            ensure a quality project performance.
